current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To provide for the management of certain inventoried roadless areas, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: finds that, for purposes of the second roadless area review and evaluation program (RARE II) and the land and resource management plan revision process under
has been adequately studied for wilderness designation and should not be recommended as potential additions to the National Wilderness Preservation System.
, the National Forest System land described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 6 of the Forest and Rangeland Renewable Resources Planning Act of 1974
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Forest and Rangeland Renewable Resources Planning Act of 1974/s:6

text.#text: The National Forest System land described in
is no longer subject to the land use restrictions of the Roadless Area Conservation Rule established under part 294 of title 36, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations); and
shall not be managed to preserve roadless or wilderness characteristics.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is each of the inventoried roadless areas within the National Forest System in the State of Wyoming, as set forth in the maps contained in the Forest Service Roadless Area Conservation, Final Environmental Impact Statement, Volume 2, dated November 2000.

text.#text: The National Forest System land referred to in

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S1967 IS: Inventoried Roadless Area Management Act
